name: Money
description: The MO data type is used to represent monetary amounts with associated currency information. It provides a standardized way to express financial values in healthcare transactions including service charges, insurance payments, copayments, deductibles, and other monetary amounts. The MO data type ensures that monetary values are always accompanied by their currency designation to prevent ambiguity in financial data exchange.

MO.1.name: Quantity
MO.1.description: The monetary amount or value. This component contains the numeric value of the money amount, including decimal precision as appropriate.

MO.2.name: Denomination
MO.2.description: The currency code or denomination for the monetary amount. Specifies the currency in which the amount is expressed (e.g., USD, EUR, CAD).

constraints.currencyRequired: Currency denomination should be specified for meaningful monetary representation
constraints.precisionHandling: Decimal precision should follow standard financial practices for the specified currency
constraints.iso4217Compliance: Currency codes should follow ISO 4217 standard where applicable
